result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Savannah Evelyn Andrade

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Savannah Evelyn Andrade appeared by video.  Attorney John Thomas Bayer appeared by video for Savannah Evelyn Andrade.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Status Conference held.  Defense requests adjourned status date as Defendant is attempting to obtain her driver's license.  Court grants request.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Savannah Evelyn Andrade not in court.  Attorney John Thomas Bayer appeared by video for Savannah Evelyn Andrade.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel has received discovery and has not received an offer and requests additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Savannah Evelyn Andrade appeared by video.  Attorney John Thomas Bayer appeared by video for Savannah Evelyn Andrade.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for a pre-trial conference. State will send discovery to Defense. Discussion held. Defense to file notice of retainer. Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 086630,
Payable Number: 1031388,
Receipt Number: 22RP036410,
Amount: $20.00

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 8/13/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.
No driving without a valid license.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Savannah Evelyn Andrade in court with attorney John Thomas Bayer.  Arthur Kenneth Thexton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Defense counsel challenges counts 1 and 3 in the complaint. Arguments heard. 
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/17/2022@2:30p
